item.title: Bluetooth and bluez inside Docker
item.description: If you have a Bluetooth device attached to a Linux system, it’s not clear how to attach that device to a Docker container on that same system. bluez, the Bluetooth driver for Linux, uses the D-Bus to communicate. This is more complex than a FIFO or socket interface, and thus less easy to obviously say how it should be mapped into the Docker processs and file system space. The references below show several ways of not doing this task, and hopefully at some point will get answers on how to do it.
